channel.title: Gcse ict?
channel.description:
Has anyone just/has done it before? Because i get to do it in year 9 :)
Just wanted to know what you accutly learn and what coursework your given.

item.title: Gcse ict?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

r4ndom1:

its unnecessary unless your planning to leave school at 16 might as well just pick something that you don’t know and perhaps take it up at A level or whatever. And how the fuck do you not attend a class? At my school they have like a mysql server for the register anyone who is not in they check up on and will be excluded if they are found to be skipping,

I guess you were speaking in reguards to me taking the ICT course yet not turning up for lessons?

Well my school is shitty and small so they don’t really give a fuck if stuff isn’t done properly. Plus the fact Music class is on the same block as ICT so i have to go to Music because i know less about it than ICT.

Read full topic

item.title: Gcse ict?
item.dc:creator: @I_Samn_I I Samn I
item.description:
@I_Samn_I wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:17, topic:187048”][quote author=goatee link=topic=249601.msg2093859#msg2093859 date=1204941352]

Wow, i was doing my second lot of SATS in yr 9…

It’s a stupid new thing called FastTrack. A group of year 8s do SATs in year 8 and GCSE in year 9 and 10. I personally would rather the whole school course because of a whole extra year of learning, it’s going to give you much better chances of a higher grade.
[/quote]
Well i think its a good idea, I was on track to do my maths GCSE at the end of year 9, though my school was shut down due to money problems.
The reason i think its a good idea is because if you do get a shit result you can always retake them in year 11, and if you do get an alright mark in year 9 then you just have more time to put more effort into your other gcse’s[/quote]

Which is why i wove it

Read full topic

[/quote]

It’s a stupid new thing called FastTrack. A group of year 8s do SATs in year 8 and GCSE in year 9 and 10. I personally would rather the whole school course because of a whole extra year of learning, it’s going to give you much better chances of a higher grade.[/quote]
Well i think its a good idea, I was on track to do my maths GCSE at the end of year 9, though my school was shut down due to money problems.
The reason i think its a good idea is because if you do get a shit result you can always retake them in year 11, and if you do get an alright mark in year 9 then you just have more time to put more effort into your other gcse’s

item.title: Gcse ict?
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“Arr0w, post:12, topic:187048”][quote author=I Samn I link=topic=249601.msg2093533#msg2093533 date=1204927004]

It’s really easy and really boring. Do it if you have time on your hands and don’t care for any alternative subjects.

I rather enjoy ICT but not at the moment as we are doing stuff I did when i was about 10.

Im dropping history + geography and bunking all RE lessons.

Wow its gay we have to take RE even tho i do not believe god.
[/quote]
Just so you know, RE isn’t just about God, infact it’s merly about God. Here we learn about Abortion(Is it right or wrong?) And Martin Luther King(The civil rights movement.[/quote]

RE Is anything to do with Religeon. Any Religeon and what them religeons are made up of eg. religious laws - Abortion etc etc

Read full topic

item.title: Gcse ict?
item.dc:creator: @I_Samn_I I Samn I
item.description:
@I_Samn_I wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:7, topic:187048”]Well in my ICT Lessons i was really bored because I could do all of the work and everyone else was like “WHAT HOW DOES I CLICKED A MOUSE”. Plus the fact you have to use Microsoft programs which is pretty crap.

But in the end i had to chose between music and ICT so i chose Music and decided to still take the ICT exam.[/quote]

Pretty much the same for me.

Also, my french teacher and humanites teachers think we are all doing our GCSE… Going back to my french teacher who said we are doing “early entry”.

Read full topic
